addressleaf.section:
To the honorable S
r
Robert Sidney knight L. Governor of the towne of Flushing.

page.lettertext:
fol.162r
S
r
Thomas Bodley to S
r
Robert Sydney
Sins my last unto yo
r
L
dship
I receaved
that letter for
e
Generall states
, w
ch
her
Ma
tie
doth mention in her letter unto
yo
w
. They doe greatly dislike this
maner of proceeding, and have replied
very effectually to her Ma
tie
upon it.
Because I thought yo
w
might desire, to
see
e forme of their answear, I have
sent yo
w
here inclosed
e transcript of it:
w
ch
yo
r
L. will be pleased to reserve
unto yo
r
self.
Count Maurice
is come
home, but sate not yet in Councell: but
by my next, I will advertise, w
at
may
be done about yo
r
company. The
surprise of
Straelen
hath failed, from
whens
Cap
t
Wray
an d
Cap
t
Clifford
are
returned a litle hurt and some twenty
of o
r
souldiers, and 7 or 8 were slaine.
I thinke
S
r
Francis Vere
will be at
e Hage
w
t
in 3 or fower daies, by whome we shall
be informed of every particularitie. of
the Enemies proceedinges we knowe no-
thing more, then yo
r
L. may see by
e letter
of
e
Councel:
for w
ch
I end w
t
my
wonted, w
ch
are alwaies my best and
most affectionat wishes to yo
r
L. estate.
From
e Hage. A
p
19 1591.
Yo
r
L
dships
assured and at commaundem
t
Tho. Bodley
